title: Community gathers in Riverton to honor longtime volunteer at Saturday memorial
image_caption: Two attendees console each other during the memorial service in Riverton’s Greenlake Park, Saturday afternoon.
content: On Saturday, more than a hundred residents gathered at Greenlake Park in Riverton for a memorial honouring a longtime neighborhood volunteer who died earlier this month.
Friends and family shared brief remarks about her work organizing food drives and mentoring teens; the service concluded with a quiet walk past a small floral tribute near the park’s south entrance.

Organizers from the Oak Street Community Center said the event was intended “simply to give neighbors a place to grieve together.” Attendees observed a moment of silence, and volunteers collected donations for the center’s youth programs. City officials said a plaque will be installed next month to recognize her service.
